name: A Natural Language Processing Approach for Personality Profiling using Fine-tuning and In-context Learning
description: A project to classify and analyse userâ€™s personality from textual data from social media using MBTI personality assessment by implementing fine-tuning BERT and prompting (GPT, LlaMa, Deepseek, and Qwen).

name: Detecting LLMs- and Human-generated Texts using Supervised Fine-tuning and Zero-shot FourierGPT across Diverse Domains
description: A project of Natural Language Processing course to detect machine-generated or human-generated English and Chinese texts using supervised fine-tuning and zero-shot FourierGPT across diverse domains.

name: Mini RAG System: YouTube Transcript Retrieval-Augmented Generation
description: A project on Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG), combining LLMs with an external knowledge source (e.g., YouTube transcripts), improving both factual correctness and domain relevance.

name: Stackoverflow Data Analysis
description: A web application that stores, analyzes, and visualizes Stack Overflow Q&A data related to Java programming, with the goal of understanding common questions, answers, and resolution activities. The analysis focuses on the most common Java topics, user engagement, exceptions and errors, and answer quality. Insights are visualized through a web application built with Spring Boot as the REST API service and Vue.js as the front-end framework. This is a group project collaborated with @SreynyTha.
course: Computer System Design and Application (CS209) Fall 2024

name: Ancient to Modern Chinese Machine Translation
description: The machine translation model uses Transformers architecture, particularly the Encoder-Decoder, to translate ancient Chinese into modern Chinese. The experiment involves a Transformer model with the encoder implemented using BERT and the decoder using GPT for the sequence-to-sequence task, specifically machine translation. This is a group project led by @LamNguyen and supervised by @Prof. Yang Xu.

name: Java Linking Game
description: A Java-based multiplayer linking game that leverages JavaFX for the user interface and incorporates server-client communication to support multiple players. The implementation involve the concept of socket programming, multithreading, and JavaFX for the UI in Java as object-oriented programming language.
course: Computer System Design and Application (CS209) Fall 2024

name: Analysis of Olympic Historical Datasets
description: Preprocessed and analyzed Olympic historical datasets using Java as an object-oriented programming language, leveraging its features such as Collections, Lambda, and Streams. The analysis includes the top 10 highest-performing female athletes in individual sports, BMI by sport, the top 10 least-represented summer sports, the top 10 countries by medals in the Winter Olympics since 2000, and the top 10 countries with the youngest athletes in the 2020 Summer Olympics.
course: Computer System Design and Application (CS209) Fall 2024

name: Campus Events and Entertainment Website
description: A ticketing website for SUSTech students and administrators to manage event ticket purchases on campus. The website allows students to view recommended events, book tickets online, rate and review events, receive notifications, accumulate points for gifts, and access live customer support. We deployed the website and conducted UI testing to ensure it is user-friendly and ready for end users. This project was led by @RyanTang.

name: Traffic-Sign Detection and Recognition
description: A traffic sign detection and recognition system using YOLOv8 in PyTorch. We experimented various models of YOLOv8 and trained it in different datasets, as well as test it in video stream recorded around campus to assess its robustness and reliability.
